quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Kolchak and Seinfeld
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, ground, seinfeld. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: On the 1970s TV show Kolchak: The Night Stalker, Kolchaks favorite baseball team was the Chicago White Sox.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who takes Frank Costanzas TV Guide in the TV series Seinfeld?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elaine

questions.question: On the TV show Seinfeld, Jerry had to give away his two Super Bowl tickets to attend whose wedding?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Drakes

questions.question: What was the name of the rogue electrician that Kramer recommended to George on the sitcom Seinfeld?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Slippery Pete

questions.question: This character, played by Simon Oakland, on Kolchak: The Night Stalker, was Kolchaks boss.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tony Vincenzo

questions.question: How long did Jerry go without vomiting on the sitcom Seinfeld?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 13 years

questions.question: What was the name of Kolchaks partner in the series Kolchak: The Night Stalker?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He didnt have a partner.

questions.question: Did Carl Kolchak, the main character on Kolchak: The Night Stalker, ever face a werewolf on a cruise ship?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: What city was the show Kolchak: The Night Stalker set in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicago

questions.question: What kind of car did Kolchak drive on Kolchak: The Night Stalker?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ford Mustang

questions.question: Who urinated on Jerrys new couch in the series Seinfeld?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Poppie

questions.question: While in L.A. trying to get his acting career off the ground, Seinfeld character Kramer got a part on what TV show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Murphy Brown

questions.question: On the TV show Kolchak: The Night Stalker, Kolchak once ran into Bigfoot.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Is Patrick Star SpongeBobs best friend?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: What popular T.V. series was claimed to have been inspired by Kolchak: The Night Stalker?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The X Files

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Series and Scrubs
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, karate, dads. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the animated series SpongeBob SquarePants, Mr. Plankton is a friend of Mr. Krabbs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In the Scrubs episode My Two Dads , Turk appears as which Star Wars character?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Han Solo

questions.question: Who was the creator of the TV series Scrubs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Lawrence

questions.question: The television series House was inspired by a newspaper article.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Does Patrick from the TV series SpongeBob SquarePants live under a rock?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Which House character said the following: Very ethical. Of course, most married men would say they dont date at all.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dr. House

questions.question: Who is SpongeBobs karate partner?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sandy Cheeks

questions.question: Who has two thumbs and doesnt give a crap is a quote by which Scrubs character?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Kelso

questions.question: In the episode of House, titled Paternity, a 16-year-old boy is admitted to the hospital because he has night terrors and double vision. What is his eventual diagnosis?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Measles

questions.question: In Episode 3, Season 1 of the TV show House a Three Dog Night song plays over the closing credits.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who is pregnant at the end of season 5 of the TV show Scrubs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carla, Jordan and Kim

questions.question: In the animated TV series SpongeBob SquarePants, does Sandy Cheeks live in a fresh air dome?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: In the TV series Scrubs, what did Turk originally want to call his baby if it was a boy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fuquon

questions.question: Snelly the Snail is SpongeBobs pet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The episode His Story in season 2 of Scrubs, is narrated from the viewpoint of which character?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dr. Cox

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Space and Statement
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, seinfeld, reaction. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Each week at the beginning of this show the newspaper editor of the local paper would start the action with this statement, This is the way it happened in the town too tough to die.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tombstone Territory

questions.question: Which statement is true about Billy Preston, who wrote the song Nothing from Nothing (Leaves Nothing)?

options.text: Billy Preston invested his money in Atlantic Records and lived quite well-off  in his later years.
Billy was a musical guest on the first Saturday Night Live.
Billy played keyboards on almost every Rolling Stones album.
Billy never again achieved a hit record.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Billy was a musical guest on the first Saturday Night Live.

questions.question: In the House episode Insensitive, Hannah who has congenital insensitivity to pain, is treated with B-12 and recovers immediately.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What do you get when you divide a positive number by zero?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It can not be done.

questions.question: What do mathematicians call a set with no elements?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The null set

questions.question: Luck is the lady that he loves best.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maverick

questions.question: In the Hindu religion, emptiness is important because nothing has a permanent, eternal identity, since everything  flows. What do Hindus call this idea of emptiness or voidness?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: sunyata

questions.question: A 1995 movie starring Bruce Greenwood told the story of a photographer who sees his entire existence erased. The movie shares its name with a Beatles song. What is the name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nowhere Man

questions.question: The creator of this television western envisioned James Bond on horseback. In what television western would you find the characters James West and Artemus Gordon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Wild Wild West

questions.question: In 1943, Carmen Laforet published this Spanish language novel about life in post-Civil War Spain.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nada

questions.question: He got fightin mad this rebel lad
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Cash

questions.question: In Seinfeld, what was Jerrys reaction when the head of NBC wanted him to add relationship humor to his sitcom, which was about nothing?

options.text: Jerry and George both refuse the suggestion.
Jerry decides to quit the entire project.
Jerry refuses the suggestion but George  talks him into it.
Jerry and George finally accept the idea.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jerry and George finally accept the idea.

questions.question: Physicists believe that the nothingness out there in space is really something. What do they call this nothingness that appears as an empty space?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black matter

questions.question: What do philosophers call the belief that the world has no essential meaning or objective truth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nihilism

questions.question: Which civilization was the first to use zero as a number?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Babylonians

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: The X-files and Files
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, people, agents. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Agent Scullys father, who died in The X-Files series, never approved of her choice of career. What was his career?

options.text: He worked in the Law Enforcement
He worked in the Central Intelligence Agency
He worked in the aerospace industry
He worked in the US armed forces

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He worked in the US armed forces

questions.question: Several episodes of The X-Files featured a child genius that was a chess whiz. What was his name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gibson

questions.question: FBI agents Fox Mulder and Dana Scully have both worn glasses at some time during The X-Files series.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Out of the night when the moon is bright  comes this bold renegade. A blade flashes and what mark is left behind?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Z

questions.question: The Greys were the type of aliens most often featured in the TV series The X-Files.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In an episode of The X-Files, Mulder found a switchblade-like device, which was the only weapon that could kill the aliens. Where did he find it?

options.text: In a secret warehouse at the Pentagon

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In a lamp

questions.question: The Bugle Theme would sound and the camera would pan down to the Old Ranger. He would stand and say Howdy, Im the Old Ranger and Death Valley is my stamping ground. What actor replaced the Old Ranger to introduce the stories of Death Valley Days?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ronald Reagan

questions.question: The Lone Gunmen, the three unusual characters who appeared in The X-Files, help Agents Mulder and Scully with a number of cases. What was their area of expertise?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Computers

questions.question: Which was the original filming location of The X-Files series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: British Columbia

questions.question: The X-Files Agent Mulder once had a brief relationship with a female who was not an ordinary person, but what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A vampire

questions.question: The X-Files, a popular American television show about paranormal phenomena, premiered in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1993

questions.question: The Tree People, investigated by  X-Files Agents Mulder and Scully were ancestors of which famous explorer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ponce de Leon

questions.question: CMT had a program on the 20 Greatest Cowboy Songs. Which song was # 1?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Happy Trails

questions.question: In an episode of The X-Files, entitled Home, the family that practiced inbreeding and buried their deformed babies in a field near their house were known by what name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Peacocks

questions.question: Assistant Director Skinner, Mulder and Scullys boss in The X-Files, was infected with an unknown agent that could kill him by the press of a button on a hand-held device. Who was the person, holding his finger on the button?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alex Krycek

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Film and Quote
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, agents, phrase. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Do, or do not. There is no try was a mystical phrase used in which classic film?

options.text: Star Wars V: The Empire Strikes Back
Close Encounters of The Third Kind

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Star Wars V: The Empire Strikes Back

questions.question: A human in which film delivered this ruthless line?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aliens

questions.question: The closing scene in the last episode of The X-Files showed Mulder and Scully in a motel, finally together after everything they had endured. Where was the motel located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roswell, NM

questions.question: Gillian Anderson, who plays Agent Dana Scully in The X-Files, also appeared in a televised adaptation of what Charles Dickens novel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bleak House

questions.question: What does the X in The X-Files stand for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Unsolved

questions.question: Which film is the quote from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Independence Day

questions.question: In The X-files, FBI Agents Mulder and Scully tried to prevent the invasion of the aliens, expected on what date?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: December 22, 2012

questions.question: Which film does the following quote come from?

options.text: Star Wars V: The Empire Strikes Back
Caravan of Courage: An Ewok Adventure
Star Wars II: Attack of the Clones

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: THX 1138

questions.question: The X-Files Agents Mulder and Scully investigated numerous cases which involved what kind of mythical monsters?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: If it bleeds, we can kill it was a quote that spelled trouble for a space critter. In which film was it uttered?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Predator

questions.question: Hey, Luke Skywalker, use the force. was a throwaway remark from which of the following characters?

options.text: Cmdr. Peter Quincy Taggart, Galaxy Quest
Han Solo, Return of The Jedi

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Spartan, Demolition Man

questions.question: Which film contains this Caroll-inspired quote?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Matrix

questions.question: This movie character had a lot to say when he described the following:

options.text: James T. Kirk, Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Doctor, Doctor Who

questions.question: Which film can you hear this chilling quote in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Matrix

questions.question: Which 1990 film does this strange sounding quote come from?

options.text: The Hitch-Hikers Guide to the Galaxy

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Total Recall

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Espn and Frog
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, frog, network. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Kermit the Frogs creator chose him as the main Muppet character because frogs were his favorite animals.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which of the following companies acquired ESPNs parent company, Capital Cities/ABC in 1995?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Walt Disney Company

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT an ESPN network.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All are ESPN networks

questions.question: In a scene of the movie Sentinel, Michael Douglas character is watching Monday Night Countdown on ESPN.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The first sporting event that aired on ESPN was a slow pitch softball game.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the name of Kermit the Frogs nephew?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robin

questions.question: What talk show did Kermit the Frog host in 1994 as an April Fools joke?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Larry King Live

questions.question: In what year were Kermit the Frog and Miss Piggy married?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1984

questions.question: A statue of Kermit and Jim Henson was erected on the campus of Jim Hensons alma mater, the University of Maryland.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What year was ESPN launched?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1979

questions.question: In what year was Kermit the Frog introduced?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1955

questions.question: In 1996 Kermit the Frog was awarded an honorary doctorate in Amphibious Papers by what British University?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Southampton College

questions.question: When Kermit first appeared on television he was more like a lizard than a frog.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In 2005, ESPN aired its last NFL Sunday Night Football game. What network took over broadcasting the Sunday night game for the 2006 NFL season ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: NBC

questions.question: ESPN and NBC are sister stations.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False
